title: William Howard Taft National Historic Site: Leave No Trace
body: Leave No Trace         Practice the 7 Leave No Trace Principles at every ourdoor recreation site you visit. The member-driven Leave No Trace Center for Outdoor Ethics teaches people how to enjoy the outdoors responsibly. This copyrighted information has been reposted with permission from the Leave No Trace Center for Outdoor Ethics: www.LNT.org  The Leave No Trace Seven Principles Take only memories & pictures, leave only footprints. It's a simple rule of thumb that allows your parks and recreation areas to thrive and be enjoyed by you and countless others who will come after you. We urge you to study and pass on the seven principles and most importantly, practice the seven principles whenever you visit any public recreation area. The Leave No Trace Seven Principles:  Plan Ahead and Prepare Travel and Camp on Durable Surfaces Dispose of Waste Properly Leave What You Find Minimize Campfire Impacts Respect Wildlife Be Considerate of Other Visitors  Remember: Removal, disturbance, destruction, or disfigurement of anything in the park is unlawful.
